Quick Facts

EXIT   X

KYC OBLIGATIONS

Page

Table of Contents

 

Safe harbour procedures are verification procedures that your organisation can use if it has a relationship with an individual that has been classified as medium or low ML/TF risk.

 

Safe harbour procedures only apply to individual customers, and the minimal KYC information must still be collected.

 

A safe harbour procedure avoids the need for your organisation to determine what identity verification process to adopt and the need to assess whether that process is independent and reliable.

 

Safe harbour procedures should be documented in your organisation's AML program.
